chapter.title: EdgeReports
chapter.para:
The EdgeReports Appliance is identified by the
symbol. If the EdgeReports Appliance is not installed, please refer to for installation instructions.

sect1.title: Administrative Interface
sect1.para: The interface for the EdgeReports Appliance is presented as three tabs. The first tab, , is a convenience which launches a web browser to view the current reports. The second tab, , is used to maintain a list of administrators who will receive daily reports via email. The last tab, , is used to provide host names for IP addresses.

sect2.title: View Reports
sect2.para: This tab is a convenience to launch a web browser to view the reports.

note.para: For security reasons, Administrators connected directly via keyboard, monitor, and mouse to the ⪚ machine cannot launch a browser.

sect2.title: Email Report Recipients
sect2.para: The Email Report Recipients tab, as shown in , lets Administrators maintain the list of email addresses of users who will receive reports by email.
To add an email address, push the add (plus) button, enter a valid email address in the Email Address field, and push the Save Settings button.

sect2.title: IP Address to User Map
sect2.para: The IP Address to User Map tab, as shown in , lets administrators maintain the names of static IP addresses. These names replace the IP addresses seen in the reports, to enhance readability.

figure.title: IP Address to User Map Tab

sect2.para: This applies for addresses in reports. For external addresses (addresses outside the protected network), it is unlikely that you could (or should) configure all IP addresses. However, for internal (protected) addresses configuring this panel makes reports more readable.
If you are using DHCP, as discussed in , then you do not need to use this tab.

question.para: I'm not getting reports, yet I added my email address to the email list as shown in ?

answer.para:
The most common error is to configure yet not turn-on the EdgeReports Appliance. Please be sure that the EdgeReports Appliance is turned on (see for a discussion of turning on/off appliances).
The next most common error is that the reports have yet to be emailed. Reports are emailed on a daily basis, so you need to wait up to 24 hours to receive your first report email.
If you have been using the ⪚ for more than 24 hours, you need to check the global email settings. Please refer to for help on these settings.
